evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root
Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25 during the historical preliminary phase withstands potential counterarguments and alternative explanations.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with the key features identified in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25 during the historical preliminary phase.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary phase on 12-25.

defeaters: Evidence showing explicit communication failures or misunderstandings among the flight crew during the preliminary phase
Reports or transcripts indicating coordination breakdown
Direct observations or recordings of communication errors

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence describes communication between flight crew and headset operator and coordination between tug instructor and trainee during pushback, but does not indicate any communication or coordination breakdown among the flight crew of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the preliminary phase. The incident of the aircraft moving beyond the TRP and hitting the blast barrier is described but no direct link to crew communication breakdown is provided (H1-H4).

slot_statements.availability: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary inspection at time 0 on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identification of the environmental or marking deficiency in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary inspection at time 0 on 12-25 is robust and resistant to potential defeaters or contradictory evidence.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The environmental or marking deficiency aligns with the key features identified for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary inspection at time 0 on 12-25.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency is present and observable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary inspection at time 0 on 12-25.

defeaters: Explicit evidence of environmental or marking deficiencies observed during the preliminary inspection
Statements confirming the adequacy or inadequacy of ground markings or environment at the time

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence describes the aircraft moving beyond the Tug release point ground markings and hitting a blast barrier, but does not explicitly state any environmental or marking deficiency was present or observable during the preliminary inspection (H4). Other history items describe personnel actions but do not mention environmental or marking deficiencies (H1-H3).
outcome.uncertainty_source: No direct mention or observation of environmental or marking deficiencies in the evidence; ambiguity whether the incident was due to deficiency or operational error

slot_statements.availability: The mechanical/control failure was present and detectable in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the historical preliminary time frame on 12-25.

Evidence showing detection of such failure by crew or systems

quotes.exact_quote: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. defeaters: If evidence showed that the personnel were not qualified or unavailable, or if the pushback was performed without qualified personnel.

quotes.exact_quote: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.
After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline.

node.statement: Availability of clear communication channels between pushback crew and flight deck

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1 directly states that the flight crew communicated with the headset operator via interphone, indicating clear communication channels. H3 supports this by describing the headset operator's position during pushback, implying active communication presence.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit mention of communication quality or any communication failures; assumption that interphone communication was clear and effective.

Reassurance and advising between tug instructor and trainee indicates use of communication protocols

If crew reported inability to communicate during the event

The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
